sentences.en: Companies from across Europe are here to unveil their latest models.
sentences.cn: 全欧洲的公司都来到这里展示其最新款产品。

sentences.en: Ford also will unveil the Focus RS, which has a top speed of 161 mph.
sentences.cn: 福特还将推出福克斯RS, 它的最高速度161英里.

sentences.en: It is also believed Pyongyang will unveil a new missile.
sentences.cn: 也有人认为,平壤会在庆典上展示新研制的导弹.

sentences.en: MARTIN WHITE is trying to unveil the history of the universe.
sentences.cn: 怀特正尝试著揭露宇宙的历史.

sentences.en: Medical Systems will unveil new technologies and approaches for radiotherapy and radiosurgery.
sentences.cn: 瓦里安医疗系统公司将推出新的技术和方法为放射治疗和放射治疗.

sentences.en: Most who unveil agendas deserve the condemnation they receive.
sentences.cn: 那些露出真面目的人就应该承受他们应得的责难.

sentences.en: Now they must pass through all of the ghosts in the mansion to unveil the secret.
sentences.cn: 现在他们一定通过大厦的所有鬼揭开秘密.

sentences.en: Nth Korea may unveil new missile at anniversary.
sentences.cn: 朝鲜将在国庆日展示新导弹.

sentences.en: Sony has conceded asby promising to unveil measures this month to further reduce yen - based costs.
sentences.cn: 索尼公司也做出了同样让步,公司允诺本月将披露具体措施,进一步削减以日元计价的成本.

sentences.en: The affective priming paradigm is a good way to unveil the relationship between emotion and cognition.
sentences.cn: 情绪启动研究是揭示情绪———认知关系的有效途径.

sentences.en: The club has unveiled plans to build a new stadium.
sentences.cn: 俱乐部首次披露了要建造一座新体育馆的计划。

sentences.en: The owl night - bound eyes are blind unto the day cannot unveil the mystery of light.
sentences.cn: 就像白天里闭上眼睛的猫头鹰,无法揭示光明的神秘面纱.

sentences.en: The owl whose night - bound eyes are blind unto the day cannot unveil the mystery of light.
sentences.cn: 猫头鹰的眼睛如果白天不是瞎的,那它晚上也揭不开夜的神秘.

sentences.en: The statue was unveiled by the Queen.
This reflects concern that some of these institutions will soon unveil further credit write - offs.
sentences.cn: 这反映出了人们的担心,即一些机构近期将宣布更多的信贷冲销.

sentences.en: Unveil the secrets of your life and deal with them directly and frankly.
sentences.cn: 揭开生命的神秘面纱,拿出勇气直面面纱之下的种种问题.

words.tran_cn: 除去遮盖物；公开；揭幕式
公开（unveile的过去分词）；原形毕露

trans.tran_cn: 揭去面纱或覆盖物； 揭幕； 首次公开、 揭露或展示
trans.tran_en: to remove the cover from something, especially as part of a formal ceremony

trans.tran_cn: 除去面纱（或覆盖物），揭幕，揭露出来，显露
揭去…的面罩，拉开…的帷幔，使公之于众，揭露
